I don't understand why she got so much hate for winning the gold medal, especially from evgenia Medvedeva fans, Alina clearly deserved her gold medal as this is incredible especially for a 15 year old
Imagine hating on such a young athlete for wining the gold medal when you should have questioned your existence because you're a couch potato and she is a 15 year old gold medallist

If you have ever seen the actual Ballet Don Quixote, you would understand, why all the jumps are at the end. That is how the actual ballet choreography goes. The many jumps at the end are the culmination of that scene. And that is how the beautiful Red Ballerina Alina danced it for us too.
She looks like a feather on ice. So elegant, so graceful, effortlessly beautiful
Don't ask me why but everytime I watch this girl doing things like this I feel like a proud mom. She's soo cute, mature, sensitive, hard-worker...
She deserved every single point both technical and artistic. She was the queen of this season whatever everybody said

At the age of 15, to be physically and mentally able to come back with that triple lutz-triple loop (even synced with music) after missing the first one, you know how strong she is here. Well in practice she did a 3-3-3-3-3, there you go.
This should be a world record. Every transitions, air positions in jump, spins. All of them executed really great

I've never seen such detailed, complex and demanding program. She is 100% deserving that medal. I love that the focus of the performance was not on jumps, rather on every ballet step, every figure, every spin. I was holding my breath throughout the entire performance. She hit every step perfectly, and she had almost no margin for mistakes. Beautifully done!

She definitely deserved her gold medal, if you‚Äôve watched her documentary, it‚Äôs just painful to see what she‚Äôs been through with her broken leg, bruises, and just her trainers difficult strategy to success (especially with her coaches always being negative and being so harsh on her), she had to relearn how to both walk and skate because of an injury, and she has been felt as if she was never standing out to fulfillment every time she did something. I really wish the best for her.

she looked so confident and positive the whole time and smiling lol love her spirit

I know this is so late, but I‚Äôm just gonna say that Zagitova‚Äôs backloading isn‚Äôt just for the score bonus.  If you search up Don Quixote gran pas de deux and find the ballet that inspired her program, you‚Äôll see that all the huge jumps are all at the very end when the music reaches it‚Äôs climax.  Alina never lost any artistry backloading either‚Äîshe stuck true to the intended pacing of her program and its original ballet version, and she‚Äôs also performing a ballet on ice, so she has to limit her facial expressions and rely soley on her technique.  Zhenya‚Äôs over exaggerated gaping wouldn‚Äôt have worked for Alina‚Äôs program, and it shows in Alina‚Äôs scores that the judges know that too.  Beautiful skate that truly reflects the grace and artistry of its original ballet.
Alina deserves GOLD. She is incredibly athletic and such a fun, dynamic skater to watch. Incredible!

I actually kind of like the way she backloads her programs (esp. Black Swan). Her jumps were placed on the music to give a very climactic feeling. And also, her natural grace makes the first half enjoyable even without the jumps. Before I knew it, it's already the second half!

What a tremendous skater!!! Such power!!! Such strength and presence of mind, wow!!! WOW!!! So happy that she won Worlds this year!!
